explains: adj. 卓越的，杰出的；高贵的，尊贵的
v. 区别，分清；使有别于；看清，认出（distinguish 的过去式和过去分词形式）
wordGroup: be distinguished from 不同于……；与……加以区别
distinguished guest 嘉宾；上宾；尊贵的客人
be distinguished by 以…为特征
be distinguished as 辨明为，称之为

sentences.en: He was the progenitor of a family of distinguished actors.
sentences.cn: 他是一个著名演艺世家的先辈。

sentences.en: His suit was immaculately cut and he looked very distinguished.
sentences.cn: 他的西服剪裁完美，人显得十分高贵。

sentences.en: He was the most distinguished scholar in his field.
sentences.cn: 他是这一领域成就最为卓著的学者。
